primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The movement of the church from safe, tribal boundaries into risky, inclusive territory through the breaking of old codes.

subject.identificatie: The Church / The Apostles / The Hearer
tekstueel_bewijs: The apostles are the ones sent.
We now live in a time of going further in obedience.

object.identificatie: The 'Further' (New territory, risky truth, inclusion of Gentiles)
tekstueel_bewijs: sent beyond safe territory for the risky truth of the gospel

zender.identificatie: The Spirit / God (via nightmares and summons)
tekstueel_bewijs: God compelled him to go further
the Spirit is restless with our tribal closures

ontvanger.identificatie: The Gentiles / The World / The Church
tekstueel_bewijs: we will be saved through the grace
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: Subject (The one being told to go)

helper.identificatie: Grace / The Spirit / Ford Motor Company Mantra
helper.rol_van_god: Helper (God empowers the human subject to act)

tegenstander.identificatie: Purity codes / Mothers / Tribalism / Safe territory
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is primarily sociological and psychological—habits and traditions—rather than cosmic sin or death.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The salvation of the church and Gentiles by grace.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Lord Jesus
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The sermon uses the primary program (Ethics/Going) as the main engine, while the secondary program (Soteriology/Grace) is mentioned as a 'contrary' belief that supports the going.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: The Spirit → Risky Truth → The Gentiles

voorbeelden_god_subject: God compelled him to go further
voorbeelden_mens_subject: The apostles are the ones sent
We now live in a time of going further

voorbeelden: rely on many things other than grace

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is driven by obligation (Imperative). Grace is framed as a tool to fulfill the obligation rather than the power that has already accomplished the work.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Purity) to ~S2 (Breaking habits) toward S1 (Grace).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved through the human act of 'going further' prompted by a 'nightmare' from God.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: S2 is treated as a social/psychological barrier rather than a state of spiritual death.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: Despite the frequent use of the word 'grace,' the actantial subject is consistently 'We' or 'The Church.' The sermon functions as a recruitment speech for social/ecclesial progress (Go further!) using God as the Sender/Helper.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: That phrase, voiced as an imperative, might be a good mantra: Go further!
reliance on God’s grace that summons to new territory

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: we believe that we will be saved through the grace of the Lord Jesus

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Peter is used as the model for the hearer's own 'going further.'
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Focus on how Christ 'went further' from heaven to the cross to include those who could not go to Him.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Pressure to perform; social activism motivation.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Sanctification is viewed as a series of human boundary-crossings.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The Ford metaphor and the Acts narrative are well-integrated rhetorically but logically prioritize the human 'Go' over the divine 'Done'.
spanning_punten: The quote from Acts 15:11 (saved by grace) contradicts the 'Go further' imperative which implies we save the church/world by our movement.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The apostles are 'grounded in faith' and 'empowered' to take risks.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'Vouloir' (restlessness) but the human must provide the 'Performance'.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is identified as 'tribalism' and 'safety'—social errors rather than ontological separation.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is anthropocentric. The 'engine' is the human will responding to a divine imperative.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The hearer is the subject of 'Go'.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make Jesus the Subject who 'went further' into our death.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'Go further in courage,' use 'Christ went further into the depths of our tribalism to pull us out.'

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Identify the hearer with the 'Gentiles' who are reached, rather than the 'Apostles' who reach.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on the 'restless Spirit' as the one who actually moves the church, rather than the church moving itself.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Identify the 'purity codes' as a form of self-righteousness that kills.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: If the opponent is just a 'habit,' we don't need a Savior, just a better 'mantra'.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (Christ went further for us) → Ethics (Therefore, we find ourselves in new territory).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon has high rhetorical energy but risks leaving the hearer exhausted by a new 'law' of progressiveness rather than comforted by the Gospel.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the Ford metaphor is clever; semiotically, it reinforces a consumerist/performance-based 'Subject' role.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might focus on the Council of Jerusalem; Greimas shows the preacher has turned a descriptive history into a prescriptive law.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that 'Grace' is being used as a 'Helper' actant to fuel a 'Subject' who is actually the Hearer.

appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on the 'Ford' metaphor, which inherently suggests human-driven progress.
